channel.title: Linux on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Linux on TLDRBins

item.title: Cron Jobs
item.description: Linux Check Cron Jobs ls -la /etc/cron.d/ cat /etc/crontab crontab -l Check background processes ./pspy Ref: pspy

item.title: Find
item.description: Linux Locate a file locate <FILE> Find files of type file find . -type f Find and Open find / -name <FILE> -exec cat {} \; Find SUID bit set files find / -type f -user root \( -perm -4000 -o -perm -2000 \) 2>/dev/null -ls Find files owned by user find / -user <USER> -ls 2>/dev/null | grep -v -e " \/proc" -e " \/sys" Find files owned by group find / -group <GROUP> 2>/dev/null | grep -v -e ^/proc Find files created between 1/1/2024 and 31/12/2024 find / -type f -newermt 2024-01-01 !

item.title: Network Discovery
item.description: Test connectivity Linux Windows # Default infinite pings ping -c3 <TARGET> # Default 5 pings ping <TARGET> # Check specific port Test-NetConnection <TARGET> -Port <TARGET_PORT> Test reverse connectivity Linux sudo tcpdump -ni tun0 icmp Sniff network traffic Linux # For example: on port 389 sudo tcpdump -i lo -nnXs 0 'port <TARGET_PORT>' # Sniff HTTPS traffic sudo ./mitmdump -p 443 --mode reverse:https://<DOMAIN> --ssl-insecure --set flow_detail=3 Ref: mitmproxy Use ping to scan subnet Linux for i in $(seq 1 254); do (ping -c 1 10.
